intro: Symplocos brandisii, commonly known as the Indian huckleberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. Its flowers are white and clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, edible berries that are red when mature. Symplocos brandisii is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and rocky slopes.
